thread.title: No need for drama -- it's time for the Rangers to make a statement
thread.title_full: Sherrington: No need for drama -- it's time for the Rangers to make a statement | Dallas Morning News

author: Sherrington
title: No need for drama -- it's time for the Rangers to make a statement
text:
On a night when the ace and the closer didn't exactly live up to pedigrees, only to be bailed out by the largesse of the Tigers, the Rangers' primary competition in the West shifted.
The Angels officially became the Rangers' biggest concern, and not just because they passed the Astros into second place.
Winners of seven in a row and 10 of 12 after last night's win over Oakland, the Angels have never been hotter.
Expect them to go to eight straight and 11 of 13 today with Garrett Richards going against Barry Zito, he of the 18.00 ERA.
The Rangers' 7-6 win over the Tigers couldn't have been much uglier. Nor more important. They won when Cole Hamels wasn't up to it and Shawn Tolleson didn't look so hot, either.
Owning a 2-game lead over the Angels and 2 1/2 over the Astros because of their loss to the Mariners, the Rangers need to finish off the Tigers today, not so much to ward off the Angels but to keep the Astros from creeping back.
Even if the Rangers lose to Detroit in the series finale, they could still hold off the Angels by splitting the four-game set in Arlington.
But they can't afford to let Houston sneak back into the race. Scott Kazmir hasn't made it out of the fourth inning in his last two starts for the Astros, but the Mariners are taking volunteers for tonight's start. After a day off Thursday, the Astros finish with three in Arizona. They'll have to make a very Mike Napoli kind of decision: Do they play Evan Gattis, the designated hitter, in left field? He's no Drew Stubbs, but, unlike Napoli going into this season, he's played it before.
Meanwhile, Yovani Gallardo makes his last case for the postseason, if there's going to be one for the Rangers. He's 0-2 with a 6.43 ERA in his last three starts.
Time to make a statement, and maybe take a little of the drama out of this weekend.
